DeployR API

6.1.1 /r/project/create - Reference Documentation

Authors: Microsoft Corporation

Version: 8.0.0

6.1.1 /r/project/create

This call creates a new project for the currently authenticated user.

If the projectname parameter is specified on the call, then the newly created project will be a persistent project . If the projectname parameter is omitted on the call, then the newly created project will be a temporary project . The projectdescr parameter is ignored if the projectname parameter is omitted.

The blackbox parameter ensures that calls on the temporary project are limited to the User Blackbox API Controls .

Using the inputs , preloadfile , preloadobject and adopt parameters the project can be pre-initialized with data in the workspace and/or working directory.

The inputs parameter allows the caller to pass DeployR-encoded R object values as inputs. These inputs are turned into R objects in the workspace of the new R session before the call returns.

The csvinputs parameter allows the caller to pass R object primitive values as comma-separated name/value pairs. These inputs are turned into R objects in the workspace before the execution begins.

The preloadbydirectory parameter allows the caller to load all files within one or more repository-managed directories into the working directory before the call returns.

The set of preloadfile parameters allow the caller to load one or more files from the repository into the working directory of the new R session before the call returns.

The set of preloadobject parameters allow the caller to load one or more binary R objects (.rData) from the repository into the workspace of the new R session before the call returns.

The set of adopt parameters allow the caller to load a pre-existing project workspace, project working directory and/or project package dependencies into the new R session before the call returns.

HTTP Method

POST

Request Format

Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded; charset=utf-8

Parameters

  • format – specifies markup encoding on the call: json or xml
  • cluster – _(optional) identifies a grid node cluster for targeted execution
  • projectname – (optional) names a new persistent project
  • projectdescr – (optional) describes a new persistent project
  • blackbox - (optional) when enabled, a temporary project is limited to user blackbox API controls
  • inputs - (optional) DeployR-encoded inputs
  • csvinputs - (optional) comma-separated list of primitive name/value inputs
  • preloadbydirectory - (optional) comma-separated list of repository directory names
  • preloadfilename - (optional) comma-separated list of repository filenames
  • preloadfiledirectory - (optional) comma-separated list of directories, one directory per preloadfilename
  • preloadfileauthor - (optional) comma-separated list of authors, one author per preloadfilename
  • preloadfileversion - (optional) comma-separated list of versions, one version per preloadfilename
  • preloadobjectname - (optional) comma-separated list of repository object (.rData) filenames
  • preloadobjectdirectory - (optional) comma-separated list of directories, one directory per preloadobjectname
  • preloadobjectauthor - (optional) comma-separated list of authors, one author per preloadobjectname
  • preloadobjectversion - (optional) comma-separated list of versions, one version per preloadobjectname
  • adoptworkspace – _(optional) identifies project from which workspace is to be adopted
  • adoptdirectory – _(optional) identifies project from which directory is to be adopted
  • adoptpackages – _(optional) identifies project from which package dependencies are to be adopted

Examples 

format=json
projectname=Demo Analysis
projectdescr=Predicting retail sales.
adoptworkspace=PROJECT-7a70bcd0-5b9b-4a83-805d-c4dd0aa51617

Response Markup (JSON)

{
    "deployr": {
        "response": {
            "call": "/r/project/create",
            "success": true,
            "project": {
                "project": "PROJECT-e2edd15f-dd67-42f6-8d82-90a2a5a669ca",
                "name": "Demo Analysis",
                "descr": "Predicting retail sales."
                "longdescr": null,
                "author": "george",
                "authors": [
                    "george"
                ],
                "shared": false,
                "origin": "Project original.",
                "lastmodified": 1378307180363,
                "live": true,
                "cookie": null
            },
            "httpcookie": "07D91F6C510E10ED84E6AC52CD0B6D1B"
        }
    }
}

Response Markup (XML)

<deployr>
  <response>
    <call>/r/project/create</call>
    <success>true</success>
    <project>
      <project>PROJECT-3d8cb9f1-def0-458b-bdf8-202b73077dc2</project>
      <name>Demo Analysis</name>
      <descr>Predicting retail sales.</descr>
      <longdescr/>
      <author>george</author>
      <authors>
        <author>george</author>
      </authors>
      <shared/>
      <origin>Project original.</origin>
      <lastmodified>1378307073917</lastmodified>
      <live>true</live>
      <cookie><![CDATA[  ]]></cookie>
    </project>
    <httpcookie>07D91F6C510E10ED84E6AC52CD0B6D1B</httpcookie>
  </response>
</deployr>
